com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WindowsCommandShell

All Superinterfaces:
CommandLineConnection2
public interface WindowsCommandShell
extends CommandLineConnection2

A connection to a Windows command shell that can be used to execute commands on a Windows machine.

The WindowsCommandShell is intended to be used instead of the deprecated WindowsShell. However, the file transfer functionality has not yet been replaced, so if this functionality is required the WindowsShell should still be used.

Method Summary
 void execute(java.lang.String command, java.io.OutputStream stdout, java.io.OutputStream stderr, long timeoutMillis)
          Execute a command.
 

Method Detail

execute

void execute(java.lang.String command,
             java.io.OutputStream stdout,
             java.io.OutputStream stderr,
             long timeoutMillis)
             throws NonZeroExitCodeException,
                    CommandFailedException,
                    ConnectionBrokenException,
                    java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Execute a command. The results of the command will be streamed back to the agent through the provided stdout and stderr output streams. The output to the respective stream depends on whether the stream is written to by the command itself.

Neither stream is required and can be null. If stdout is not provided then FglAM will log any output received at debug level. A null stderr parameter will cause FglAM to log errors for any input received on that stream.

Specified by:
execute in interface CommandLineConnection2
Parameters:
command - The command to execute
stdout - An output stream that the command's stdout data will be written to, or null otherwise
stderr - An output stream that the command's stderr data will be written to, or null otherwise
timeoutMillis - The timeout in milliseconds for executing the command
Throws:
NonZeroExitCodeException - The process returned a non-zero exit code
CommandFailedException - The operation encountered an error, but does not indicate that the connection itself failed
ConnectionBrokenException - The connection was broken
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The operation did not complete within timeoutMillis milliseconds.
java.lang.InterruptedException - The operation was interrupted before it could complete
